Secondly, they want to thank Odile Hainaut and Claire Pijoulat of WantedDesign and Phil Robinson of the...
text:
Be Original Americas, the non-profit advocacy group for original design, has
announced updated information on the first worldwide virtual student
fellowship. From June 15 - July 17, 2020, 26 design companies, makers, and
creators will present through a series of webinars to a global audience of
students. Each session will focus on a different aspect of the design process
and provide an inside look into the factories, architecture and design
studios, and headquarters of Be Original Americas member companies around the
world creating authentic design. The program will offer insights from leading
brands, makers, and creators to learn about working in an industry that shapes
the way we live, work, and play.

Firstly, Be Original Americas announced the addition of Charlene C. Lam, to
our team as Content Producer. Charlene's clients include WantedDesign and
other creative organizations. Charlene will help Be Original Americas produce
a cohesive, engaging online program for these global students, and we are
truly lucky to have her.

Secondly, they want to thank Odile Hainaut and Claire Pijoulat of WantedDesign
and Phil Robinson of the International Contemporary Furniture Fair
(ICFF)--which is owned by Emerald X, the parent company of Contract magazine--
for their support of this program.

Carl Hansen & Søn is releasing the iconic Wishbone chair in five Special
Edition matte finishes, aptly referred to as Soft Colors, in partnership with
Be Original Americas. A portion of proceeds from all sales of the CH24 Soft
chairs will benefit Be Original Americas' Student Fellowship program.

This virtual student fellowship was developed in place of Be Original Americas
Annual Design Fellowship, in which two students won the opportunity to visit
studios and companies, and speak to designers, makers, and creators in person
in multiple cities. Due to the current situation, this iteration allows for
many more students around the world access to these member companies globally.

Hundreds of students have already registered. This opportunity is available to
currently enrolled university students. Students around the world are welcome
to attend. To register and receive updates, please visit their page.

Register for one or all of the first Be Original Americas virtual fellowship
sessions here.

title: Be Original Americas Shares Updated Information on First Worldwide Virtual Student Fellowship
html:
Be Original Americas, the non-profit advocacy group for original design, has announced updated information on the first worldwide virtual student fellowship. From June 15 – July 17, 2020, 26 design companies, makers, and creators will present through a series of webinars to a global audience of students. Each session will focus on a different aspect of the design process and provide an inside look into the factories, architecture and design studios, and headquarters of Be Original Americas member companies around the world creating authentic design. The program will offer insights from leading brands, makers, and creators to learn about working in an industry that shapes the way we live, work, and play.

Firstly, Be Original Americas announced the addition of Charlene C. Lam, to our team as Content Producer. Charlene’s clients include WantedDesign and other creative organizations. Charlene will help Be Original Americas produce a cohesive, engaging online program for these global students, and we are truly lucky to have her.

Secondly, they want to thank Odile Hainaut and Claire Pijoulat of WantedDesign and Phil Robinson of the International Contemporary Furniture Fair (ICFF)—which is owned by Emerald X, the parent company of Contract magazine—for their support of this program.

Carl Hansen & Søn is releasing the iconic Wishbone chair in five Special Edition matte finishes, aptly referred to as Soft Colors, in partnership with Be Original Americas. A portion of proceeds from all sales of the CH24 Soft chairs will benefit Be Original Americas’ Student Fellowship program.

This virtual student fellowship was developed in place of Be Original Americas Annual Design Fellowship, in which two students won the opportunity to visit studios and companies, and speak to designers, makers, and creators in person in multiple cities. Due to the current situation, this iteration allows for many more students around the world access to these member companies globally.

Hundreds of students have already registered. This opportunity is available to currently enrolled university students. Students around the world are welcome to attend. To register and receive updates, please visit their page.

Register for one or all of the first Be Original Americas virtual fellowship sessions here.
